drift.name: No Drift
drift.description: No detectable deviation from expected meaning, constraints, workflow, or pacing.

drift.name: Information Drift
drift.description: System output contradicts available facts, tool results, or previously established truth.

drift.name: Context Drift
drift.description: Loss or misuse of previously established context or constraints.

drift.name: Intent Drift
drift.description: System shifts the task direction or goal without user signal.

drift.name: Procedural Drift
drift.description: System diverges from expected workflow sequence or operational role.

drift.name: Pacing / Latency Drift
drift.description: Timing behavior creates confusion, expectation mismatch, or trust loss.

repair.name: No Repair
repair.description: No explicit attempt to resolve drift within the labeled segment.

repair.name: Local Repair
repair.description: Minor correction without modifying global structure or resetting context.

repair.name: Structural Repair
repair.description: Fixing internal state: workflow, memory, slot values, or constraint restoration.

repair.name: UX Repair
repair.description: Stabilizing pacing, timing, or feedback for perceived continuity.

repair.name: Hard Repair (Reset)
repair.description: Discarding current context and intentionally restarting workflow.

reentry.name: No Reentry
reentry.description: No return to intended workflow or goal within the labeled segment.

reentry.name: Intent Reentry
reentry.description: User or system explicitly restores the original task or goal.

reentry.name: Constraint Reentry
reentry.description: Previously stated parameters or requirements are restored or re-validated.

reentry.name: Workflow Reentry
reentry.description: System resumes the intended execution sequence after correction.
